Table of Contents

Class SelectedFile

Namespace
MdFilesMerger.Domain.Entity
Assembly
MdFilesMerger.Domain.dll

Implementation of selected file model associated with located in main directory .md file, whose content will be included in created merged file.

Inheritance: BaseItem -> BaseDirectory -> MdFile -> RelativeFile -> SelectedFile
Implements: IComparable<T>, IDirectory, IEditFile, IItem, IRelativeFile, ISelectedFile 

public sealed class SelectedFile : RelativeFile, IComparable<BaseDirectory>, ISelectedFile, IEditFile, IRelativeFile, IDirectory, IItem

SelectedFile(int, string?, int, DateTime, string?)

Sets all properties to values of appropriate arguments.

public SelectedFile(int id, string? path, int mainDirId, DateTime modifiedDate, string? title)

Parameters

id int

Identification number of item.

path string

Valid relative path to existing .md file associated with this item. Path should use '/' as directory separator.

mainDirId int

Id of MainDirectory object associated with this item.

modifiedDate DateTime

Date and time of last modification of this entity.

title string

Text put as table of contents entry connected with contend of associated .md file.

Remarks

No evaluation or adjusting is performed, so use this method only for already evaluated and prepared data, for example from database.

See Also
BaseDirectory
BaseItem

IDirectory

IRelativeFile
ISelectedFile

Properties

Title

Text that will be put in table of contents (if it will be included) as header pointing in created merged file to content of associated with this instance file.

public string? Title { get; set; }

Property Value

string

By default set to null or, if Name is set to associated .md file path, to text of header of this file (if exists) or filename without extension (if file doesn't have header).

GetDefaultTitle(string?)

Opens the file and reads first not empty line of text from it.

public static string GetDefaultTitle(string? filePath)

Parameters

filePath string

Absolute path of file.

Returns

string

If read line is a header (starts with '#') return it. If header contains hyperlink, method returns only text part of it. If read line is not a header, return filename, without extension. If file header is a link return only text part.

Opens the file and reads first not empty line of text from it.

public string GetFileHeader(string? mainDirPath)

Parameters

mainDirPath string

Absolute path of main directory.

Returns

string

If read line is a header (starts with '#') return it. Else return filename, without extension. If file header is a link return only text part.

SetPath(string?, string?)

Sets Name to relative path with '/' as directory separator.

public override bool SetPath(string? path, string? mainDirPath)

Parameters

path string

Absolute or relative (to current directory) path to existing .md file associated with this instance.

Absolute or relative (to current directory) path to base directory, associated with this instance.

mainDirPath string

Absolute or relative (to current directory) path to existing .md file associated with this instance.

Absolute or relative (to current directory) path to base directory, associated with this instance.

Returns

bool

true, if Name was successfully set to path; otherwise false.

Remarks

Set path is relative to mainDirPath. If path doesn't point to existing .md file, Name is set to null.

If Name was successfully set to path and Title is null, Title is set to appropriate default value.

See Also
